top_comment.text:
I'm not hating but you shouldent put your dogs name on its collor just its 
other dietals 
﻿
top_comment.author: snowybearcs

comments.text:
Ok sorry i didn't mean it in anyway i just thought it would be nice to know 
be it doesn't matter now
comments.author: snowybearcs

comments.text:
+snowybearcs In my opinion it's important that people know my dog's name so 
they can call him over and keep him feeling safe IF he were to ever get 
lost. I'm not sure why there would be such an issue with people knowing 
your dog's name, for any reason. I do not put my last name on the collar so 
I don't think it's a big deal. If you do not personally know why you 
should/shouldn't put your dog's name on the collar please do not comment, 
it will confuse people.
comments.author: Faris Jaclyn

comments.text:
i dont know exactly my step mum work at the rspca and she said you just 
shouldent ill try and find out
comments.author: snowybearcs

captions.text: Hey guys it's Faris, Pet Expert and Dog Trainer for SuperAwesomeDogs.com
and today I want to talk to you about the six items you need for your dog.
Now, when you walk into a pet store it's really confusing!
There's SO many things!
But I want to tell you what you need for your essentials.
-music playing-
First, you want to make sure that you have a bed for your dog.
A place that he can call his own that he can sleep in at night.
You can have him in your bed and sleep with you if you want
But, if you want to keep your bed fur free and dirt free
have a bed where they can sleep in
You want to make sure that you have a collar for your dog with tags on it
Now, these tags is your dog's ticket home!
It's going to have his name on it
with a phone number and some other contact information
of your's in case your dog ever gets lost.
-music playing-
So we are going to talk about different types of collars
This is a buckle collar
Really this should just be used as identification for your dog
You are just putting it on the dog with tags
A lot of people just use a buckle collar for leash work
But it doesn't give a lot of give and it really puts a lot of strain on their trachea.
You can get a martingale collar
this has a little loop on one side
so it goes snug on the dog's neck
this is better than a regular collar
because it's going to give even pressure around the entire neck
not just in the front really putting a lot of strain on that trachea
-music playing-
this is a gentle leader
kind of like a horse haulter
it's a face collar
So when you put it on you get to lead the dog's face
because the face leads the entire body of the dog
You are going to have a lot of more control
this is a chest harness
it goes around the chest
just on the top and on the back
Bueller has a chest harness on right now
Basically you are guiding the dog
kind of like the gentle leader that goes around the face
but it goes on the front of the body
and guides the dog that way
it doesn't put a lot of strain on the trachea like neck collar would
it's really good for small dogs like Bueller
If you do want to use prong collars, pinch collars, chock collars
you should really only use them if you contact a professional with those
those can really do a lot of damage if you do not know how to correctly use them
so I would say, just use something like what I've shown you.
chest harness, face harness (gentle leader),
or a martingale collar.
for something easier and not so painful
I wouldn't suggest using retractable leashes
they are kind of messy
they go in and out
they do not give a lot of strain
you want to have your dog next to you on the side
you do not want to have your dog out infront of you
having a proper leash that you can have your dog next to you is ideal
-music playing-
Toys are really great for your dog
you want to stimulate their minds
always have fun squeaky toys, depending on what your dog likes,
if your dog chews theses up, get something more sturdy like balls
tugs of war toys. Stuffed animals are really great with squeakers!
Dogs really like those
Puzzles! Especially for puppies!
You put treats in here
You shut it
it teaches the dog how to get the treat out of the puzzle
it's sort of like a brain game for your dog
it gives them something to really think about
really work at
-music playing-
Kongs are really great!
You can stuff them with cheese or even healthier options like bananas and carrots
or peanut butter
you can even put it in the freezer
let it freeze and then it can be even more secure and hard. Then your dog will have to work at it and get it out of there
Kongs are good for dogs because they like to chew on things!
You should definitely get your dogs chews!
and rawhides!
This is going to help your dog with tartar and build up on it's teeth.
it's going to push away that tartar and get them something to work on
dogs instinctively chew on things, so you want to make sure
that your dog has the correct chew and they are not chewing on chairs and on your shoes!!!
-music playing-
Lastly you want to get a crate for your dog, this is their bedroom, it's a place that they are going to call their own
you own the entire house!
this is their den, their bedroom
this is where they can call their own
you talked about crate training in our potty training episode, so be sure to check it out
-music playing-
Alright guys thanks for watching!
This is your bare essentials for owning a dog
now remember our dogs give us unconditional love
So we need to give them love back by supplying them with awesome and fun stuff to do
My name is Faris and you are watching SuperAwesomeDogs.com
Be sure to check out more videos to learn about how to take care of your dog
Please subscribe!!!!!

title: 6 MUST HAVE Items Every Dog Owner Needs
